intro: Mariscus pennatus, commonly known as the featherleaf lichen, is a species of lichen that belongs to the family Parmeliaceae. It is characterized by its intricate, branching structure and a pale to dark green or yellowish thallus. The plant forms a symbiotic relationship between a fungus and a photosynthetic partner, typically a green alga or cyanobacterium. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found on tree bark or soil surfaces. Its morphology and ecological role make it an important indicator species for environmental conditions.
